Gabriel \"Gabe\" Walker.Action: Bends down to accept the match from Hal, sharing a familiar routine indicating long-term friendship.
Scales the tower swiftly and fearlessly to rescue Hal and Susan without hesitation.
Lightheartedly challenges Hal asking why he is rescuing him, showing friendly banter.
Fearlessly and swiftly scales the tower without safety lines, demonstrating experience and confidence.
Finds a difficult fingertip-width handhold and successfully pulls himself up, showing physical skill and problem-solving under pressure.
Attempts to light a cigarette but lighter only sparks, indicating a minor lapse or moment of frustration, though resolved by Hal lighting a match.
Carefully secures rescue line, extinguishes and pockets cigarette butt to avoid littering, instructs Hal on safety during the rescue
Slightly teasing tone when asking Susan if Hal is showing her a good time
Reassures Susan loudly and calmly, saying 'Hold on. I'm coming out to get you.'
Maintains eye contact with terrified Susan and encourages her 'Keep looking at me...'
Maintains control and calms Susan by loudly reassuring her and signaling 'OK' and 'you're doing fine'.
Quickly assesses the failure of Susan's harness and immediately decides to rescue her by climbing out on the line with safety precautions.
Carefully clips himself with a three-foot safety line before attempting the rescue, demonstrating prudent risk management.
Smoothly and quickly pulls himself out on the line, showing physical skill and confidence.
Increases his speed urgently to prevent Susan from losing her grip, demonstrating situational awareness and urgency without panicking.
Urgently pulls himself along the line to reach a terrified Susan, locking eyes and encouraging her to keep looking at him.
Deliberately lets go of the main line and launches himself at Susan to try to catch her as she falls.
Is helpless and anguished after Susan falls, unable to shut his eyes or intervene further.
Urgently pulls himself out quickly and smoothly toward Susan, trying not to shake the line.
Keeps eye contact with Susan and instructs her to keep looking at him to help her hold on.
Recognizes that the top clip is failing and pulls himself faster to reach Susan despite the worsening situation.
Deliberately lets go of the main line and launches himself to catch Susan when she falls.
Fails to catch Susan's hand as she falls; sways helplessly and can only watch her fall, unable to act further.
Admits to feeling responsible for Susan Collins' death despite reassurance from Maggie.
Questions Maggie's belief that the accident was no one's fault, showing emotional vulnerability and need for reassurance.
Responds with a somewhat bitter and unresolved attitude about the tragedy, reflecting internal guilt and emotional pain.
Acknowledges the equipment failure explanation but doubts its truth, showing self-doubt and guilt over Susan Collins's death.
Maintains control and composure upon landing despite tense conversations, calmly exits the helicopter and faces the unfolding situation.
Engages in a hostile confrontation with Hal, escalating quickly to physical violence.
Agrees to meet new rookies after being steered away from conflict by Frank.
Confidently explains security measures and trusts the thoroughness of his checks, showing knowledge of the operation and use of electronic tracking devices.
Dismisses outside warnings somewhat brusquely, perhaps underestimating the threat indicated by Matheson's concern.
Brushes snow from Susan Collins' grave, lays down flowers, pauses in remembrance.
Looks out the window wondering if he still belongs to the countryside.
Pauses thoughtfully at a cemetery marker, showing emotional reflection but no direct action related to his skills or confidence at this moment.
No direct action taken in this excerpt; focus is on Travers and others handling risky midair operations.
No direct action or involvement visible in this excerpt; others are shown struggling with crisis, but Gabe's behavior is not described.
Smiles at a memory of happier times with Maggie and Hal, showing a sincere connection to past relationships.
Cautiously enters the cabin and investigates quietly without forcing his way or causing damage.
Shuts the back door after noticing it was open, showing respect for the property.
Asks Maggie to introduce him to the injured eagle, shows concern for the animal's condition, calls the poachers 'bastards,' offers to help with the dressing rather than just watching.
Expresses awkwardness upon arrival, suggesting social discomfort but a willingness to engage nevertheless.
Accurately assesses the eagle's age and condition, shows understanding of the situation (poached eagle, about first flight).
Recognizes Maggie needs help and offers to assist with the dressing change, finds and gathers necessary medical supplies.
Acknowledges his effect on the eagle getting nervous and adapts by taking over the bandage cleaning while Maggie holds it.
Appears awkward and somewhat unsure on initial meeting, hesitant in introduction.
Expresses sincere feelings to Maggie, admits emotional pain and vulnerability, and expresses hope to start over together.
Reaches tentatively for Maggie's face but respects her personal boundary when she pushes his hand away.
Carefully tapes a small patch and sticks it on the eagle's side, showing attention to detail and skill.
Expresses emotional vulnerability and hesitation, reaching tentatively for Maggie's face but being pushed away.
Acknowledges the emotional impact of returning, demonstrating self-awareness but not decisive action regarding his situation.
Invites Maggie to start over somewhere else, showing forward thinking and initiative.
Does not assertively react to Maggie's rejection, shows limited resolve or forcefulness in personal matters.
Responds quickly and with anger when confronted by Hal, showing readiness to engage.
Refuses to help with the rescue citing past guilt and personal boundaries.
Acknowledges Hal's point and feels hesitant and scared but initially resists involvement.
Shows emotional pain and avoidance related to past tragedy involving a lost climber.
"You've soloed that wall" indicates past high-level climbing skill and competence.
Refuses to participate in a rescue despite knowing the risk to others, citing conscience and fear of responsibility.
Acknowledges his hesitation and fear internally, showing self-awareness but also reluctance to act in crisis.
Ultimately slows down when confronted but does not fully commit to helping, demonstrating indecision under pressure.
Acknowledges Hal's concerns about the bolt gun and reassures him by calling it just a backup.
Engages in friendly banter with Hal about the climbing bet and offers to return the money if they survive the climb.
Leads the climb up a difficult, vertical ice face, skillfully placing pitons and securing the rope as a safety net, confidently communicates the anchor point to Hal.
Warns Hal loudly about the rockslide, takes precautions anchoring the rope early.
Quickly reacts to Hal's fall by removing the carabiner clip to arrest the fall.
Anchors the rope securely under a ledge despite difficult ice conditions and warns Hal about the rockslide, showing awareness and quick communication.
Hugs the ice wall and makes himself as flat as possible during the rockslide, demonstrating presence of mind in crisis.
Quickly reaches to remove the carabiner clip after seeing Hal fall to prevent further rope failure, showing quick problem-solving under pressure.
Warns Hal loudly about the rockslide to keep him safe.
Acts quickly and decisively to save Hal by firing a bolt to anchor the rope despite personal risk.
Suffers pain and shock from the impact while securing Hal's safety, showing self-sacrifice.
Shares a vulnerable, relieved laugh with Hal after narrowly avoiding disaster, reconnecting their friendship.
Quickly removes the carabiner clip from the piton after Hal falls to prevent further danger.
Rapidly uses the bolt gun to secure a new anchor in solid rock after the pitons fail.
Braces himself against the jolt of Hal's fall by lashing the rope to his shoulder and fixing his feet in the ice despite the dangerous conditions.
Shows shaken and wheezing physical reaction after the jolt, indicating vulnerability, but still communicates clearly to Hal that the anchor is secure.
Maintains presence of mind to inform Hal the anchor is secure and encourages him, which helps Hal regain composure.
Encourages Hal by saying 'Come on -- the hard part's over.'
Helps Hal up as they reach the mountain edge.
Expresses suspicion about the crash site, showing concern for accuracy and reality.
Warily inspects the plane interior rather than rushing in recklessly.
Observes footprints and a cable thoughtfully, indicating alertness but no hostile reaction.
Keeps hands on head quietly when threatened and allows confiscation of his weapons without resistance.
Brevity and matter-of-factly reply when Travers comments on Maggie being 'very attractive' ('My ex').
Notes fresh footprints and cable wrapped around a tree, recognizing it as no ordinary accident before being caught
Does not resist when surrounded and caught at gunpoint, complies with hands on head and surrenders equipment
Nods in agreement under threat, despite obvious danger and pressure
Leads the group up a difficult climb, helping others follow his example
Pauses thoughtfully when deciding the safest route, showing caution and consideration
Quietly tells Hal they don't have to do this, suggesting empathy and hesitation about the dangerous situation
Suggests alternative plan to get ahead of pursuers and acknowledges risks sincerely.
Nods grimly on realizing Maggie's danger but keeps moving, showing concern but also composure.
Responds to hostile command from Travers with a calm but firm request for tools rather than confrontation.
Fastens crampons and tapes his fingers carefully to protect himself despite the cold, showing meticulous preparation and self-care.
Continues to push himself through pain and danger without complaint, focusing on the task despite the fear and difficulty.
Meticulously tapes up his hands and fingers before a difficult climb to protect against injury.
Successfully navigates a highly challenging and dangerous climbing section, despite physical pain and difficulty.
Remains focused and controlled on the wall, mentally managing fear despite being thousands of feet above solid ground.
Does not hesitate or show doubt even in one of the worst possible climbing situations, pushing through physical and mental barriers.
Refuses to simply lower the money case down, instead challenging the pursuers to come up and get it, showing defiance and a willingness to confront danger directly.
Manages to recover the money case despite its battered state, forces open the trashed locks, and assesses the contents quickly.
Refuses to lower the case down despite instructions, instead proposes a tactical plan to force adversaries to come to him, indicating strategic thinking and confidence.
Maintains composure and uses limited cover effectively while under heavy gunfire on a precarious ledge, showing skill and calm under pressure.
Keeps calm under extreme pressure, encourages himself silently ('Come on') while facing deadly risk.
Drops the case thereby potentially sacrificing valuable money but prioritizing survival and possibly others' safety.
Holding onto the wall despite an avalanche and gunfire, nearly swept away but surviving by clinging to the cliff.
Disappears beneath snow and rock with no immediate visible movement, creating uncertainty about his status.
Gabe digs himself out of a narrow, ice- and snow-packed crevice with difficulty, then leans against the wall to rest, showing survival skill and physical capability under harsh conditions.
Improvises by tying a crampon to one hand and uses it to climb a difficult icy wall despite barely having the strength to hold on.
Keeps pushing himself to climb despite exhaustion and freezing conditions, using humor to cope (talking about steambath, whiskey, steak).
Hesitates to smash the glass display containing historical climbing equipment, showing respect instead.

Despite frozen fingers and extreme danger, Gabe skillfully removes crampons, times his swings perfectly to resecure them, and then climbs out of the overhang, demonstrating strong technical skill and composure under pressure.
Shows momentary terror and desperation when struggling with frozen crampon buckles, indicating vulnerability but quickly recovers.
Runs efficiently up the ice slope after reattaching crampons, displaying stamina and determination.
Approaches the historic display with respect rather than destroying it outright, indicating thoughtful decision-making beyond pure survival tactics.
Hesitates before smashing the glass, showing respect and promises to return it.
Laughs while digging out the case, indicating positive engagement and relief.
Scans the treeline carefully, spots a tree with broken branches indicating something is off, and responds quickly by rushing toward it.
Frantically digs through snow at the summit and successfully locates the hidden case by the blinking tracer light.
Watches the chaos with a grin from a slightly elevated vantage point, recognizing the others are searching in the wrong direction.
Attempts to circle closer to where Travers is holding Hal to intervene.
Runs and dodges bullets, showing focus on survival rather than aggressive retaliation.
Fumbles in his backpack but successfully pulls out an ancient flare that could be useful.
Throws a flare to blind Ryan and then rushes to tackle him, putting himself in danger to stop an imminent threat.
Engages in physical struggle, trying to disarm Ryan rather than harm him lethally.
Pulls out an old flare despite uncertain condition and successfully ignites it under pressure.
Uses the flare effectively as a distraction against Ryan, causing a blinding flash.
Charges directly toward Ryan despite the danger of being fired upon and successfully tackles him before the gunfire can hit.
Responds quickly to Ryan's axe attack by rolling away in time, showing quick reflexes and situational awareness.
Attempts to seize Ryan's machine gun during the struggle, demonstrating initiative.
Loses hold of the machine gun due to Ryan's counterattack and both tumble over the ice slope.
Confidently drops down onto a familiar ledge and uses his memory to find a hidden stash in a cave, demonstrating familiarity and resourcefulness.
Uses a dim penlight but quickly switches to a lighter when batteries are low, showing adaptability.
Stops to drink whiskey from the found stash, enjoying a moment of peace despite the urgency of the situation.
Clobbers an aggressive rat with a rock decisively, demonstrating quick reflexes and decisive action.
After killing the rat, pulls out a pocket knife possibly preparing for further action, showing preparedness and caution.
Butchers and eats a rat to survive while carefully managing limited resources (money, alcohol).
Pulls his jacket on reversed to make himself less visible, chooses a walking route along rock shelves, showing thoughtful planning and caution.
Reacting instantly to the sound of machine gun fire, attempts to climb up to intervene despite the danger and limited options.
Reacts to the sound of machine gun fire and climbs up to engage, despite realizing there's nothing he can do immediately.
Watches Evan falling and advises him to wait until out of range before pulling the parachute, showing tactical patience and careful judgment.
Turns away, unable to watch Evan hit bottom, grimaces and looks up with absolute hate at Travers who laughs at Evan's desperation.
Quietly vows 'Don't worry. You will.' to Travers after Evan's death.
Watches Evan fall helplessly, powerless to intervene or save him.
Expresses strong hatred and determination toward the antagonist Travers, indicating mental resilience and resolve.
Starts out on a parallel path along the ledges after the tragedy, implying proactive continuation of mission or pursuit.
Observes Hal and the gang from a hidden vantage point, carefully assessing the terrain before attempting to approach.
Watches Hal and the others cautiously from a concealed position, carefully assessing the situation before attempting to follow.
Uses binoculars to carefully examine the difficult terrain feature (the chimney crevice), noting its complexity and unpredictability before proceeding.
Uses binoculars to survey a difficult climbing route and then confidently chooses to wedge himself into a narrow crack to ascend and tunnel through the mountain formation.
Sweating and straining while climbing up a difficult chimney with no place to pull back.
Feels nausea and admits to making a big mistake while trapped in dark, tight mountain crack.
Navigates a cramped, pitch dark, dangerous crack inside a mountain, recognizing his mistake but still continuing upward.
Remains focused and perseveres despite physical pain and difficult conditions.
Mumbles a curse quietly while focusing on his precarious situation.
Painfully brakes his fall using his arms and legs, showing resilience.
Remains braced and endures physical hardship quietly without complaint or self-pity.
Skillfully ascends a difficult vertical mountain crack by methodically using one arm and one leg to brace and then moving the others, demonstrating physical competence and technique.
Faced with no handholds to swing over a curved edge, does not give up but creatively uses his arms to push off and spring into a diagonal passage, showing problem-solving and confidence.
Lands hard but immediately digs in with boots and hands to stop sliding and regains a stable crouching position before continuing upward, demonstrating quick reflexes and composure.
Strains to hear Kynette's radio message despite the dangerous and tiring climb, showing concern and alertness.
Does not directly intervene or act during the hostile encounter between Kynette and Maggie, possibly indicating restraint or caution rather than warmth.
Assesses the top of the crack carefully, noting snow conditions and light, and braces his back against one wall to climb the easy segment confidently and skillfully.
Hears muffled conversation on radio and realizes it might not be a good time to emerge from his position, indicating awareness of situational timing.
Completes a risky physical move by kicking an attacker over the edge, despite being visibly battered and dirty.
Quickly assesses danger and uses the environment to his advantage by collapsing snow to create a barrier and then rappelling down a rope expertly.
Protects Maggie by shielding her from gunfire while under attack, showing situational awareness and prioritization.
Does not display hesitation or confusion despite severe injuries and immediate threat, instead acts decisively.
Throws himself over Maggie to shield her from ricocheting bullets.
Edges Maggie down into a narrow crack and leads her carefully along a ledge.
Recognizes his own limits and insists on stopping despite Maggie's protests.
Tugs gently on the rope to communicate with Kynette.
Yanks the rope down hard, unintentionally causing Kynette to fall.
Gabe carefully edges Maggie down into a narrow crack, guiding her along a ledge despite dangerous conditions.
After feeling the rope go taut, Gabe yanks down hard, causing Kynette to fall headfirst into the crack, losing control of the rope.
Recognizes the danger and instructs Maggie to stop moving despite her protests, showing situational awareness and caution.
Throws himself over Maggie to shield her from gunfire, showing protective instinct but possibly risking his own safety.
Expresses gladness to see Maggie but also admits frustration she came, showing complex sincere emotions.
Attempts communication with rescue unit despite weak radio signal, showing perseverance and trust in others.
Attempts to use the radio despite difficult conditions to call for rescue support, showing resourcefulness and persistence.
Stops to catch his breath and acknowledges his exhaustion, showing awareness of his limits.
Expresses frustration about the department's state after his absence ('I take a year off and the department goes to hell') with a tone of concern and responsibility.
Makes an effort to communicate and coordinate with the rescue team over the radio in a stressful situation.
Attempts to communicate over the damaged radio despite interference; tries to check if others are on the radio to coordinate rescue.
Expresses frustration indirectly blaming department decline while taking action to contact rescue.
Grabs Maggie to prevent her from slipping during the blast, tries to protect her with his body as rocks rain down.
Braces over Maggie to shield her from falling rocks during the rockslide.
Frantically digs to rescue Maggie after the cave-in, risking himself.
Catches Maggie as she tumbles out, brushes dirt off her face, asks if she is all right.
Refuses to take a riskier escape route suggested by Maggie to protect them both from potential danger.
Unsheathes his ice axe and starts hacking up to get at Maggie, digging frantically despite falling dirt and rocks.
Stops himself from falling further by jamming his body against the sides of the crack to brace during the rockslide.
Leads Maggie through the crack and makes a calculated decision to avoid going up an opening that might have another bomb or cause another cave-in, choosing the only sure way out through the side.
Smiles encouragingly to Maggie, saying 'Come on -- we're almost out.'
Engages in a brutal fight with Kynette, showing determination and resilience but no indication of friendliness or trustworthiness in this context.
Despite being in a rotten fighting position and physically weaker momentarily, Gabe uses quick thinking to trap Kynette's knife hand in the rock wall and uses the opponent's own momentum against him.
Initially throws a weak punch that fails to stop Kynette and gets hit hard, ending up in a vulnerable position straddling the crack walls.
Shoves Maggie forward to protect her from the rockslide and urges her to move quickly.
Shoves Maggie forward to escape the imminent rockslide, demonstrates quick decision-making under pressure.
Moves quickly despite dangerous conditions, effectively responding to the airburst and collapsing terrain.
Hands Maggie a piton and instructs her how to secure it, sharing equipment and guiding her.
Urgently communicates bad and good news to Maggie in a calm, clear manner to ensure teamwork and safety.
Expresses defeat and fear, says sorry to Maggie for the situation.
Shares a tight, reassuring embrace with Maggie before acting.
Breaks off embrace to start unraveling rope with inspired urgency, showing presence of mind to help.
Feels completely defeated and says 'Die. I'm sorry, Maggie. I'm sorry you got into this.'
Notices the frayed end of the rope, shows inspiration, and starts furiously unravelling it to solve the problem.
Calmly assesses old rope for rescue, advises Maggie with practical knowledge, encourages her to go first.
Quickly calculates the rope's strength based on old climbing knowledge and confidently directs Maggie to tie the ropes together, trusting the old equipment to hold their weight.
Dismisses Maggie's concern about the rope being sixty years old without fully considering the risk of the rope’s age on its reliability.
Directs Maggie to swing toward the cave and drop, demonstrating quick decision-making under pressure.
Falls when the rope snaps but immediately tries to regain position and avoid slipping over the edge, showing physical skill and situational awareness.
Carefully rolls Maggie over to check if she is okay after the rockslide.
Explains the dangerous situation to Maggie honestly and with concern.
Attempts to take the lead in reaching the money despite obvious physical pain.
Carefully rolls Maggie over after the rockslide and assesses her condition before acting further.
Explains the situation clearly and logically to Maggie, showing awareness of the thieves' plans and positions.
Plans to get to the location first by making it along the north wall to the Bitker ladder despite his weakened state.
Appears physically weak and lurches like Quasimodo rather than showing typical confidence or strength of a champion climber.
Mentions intending to do "something -- subtle," without outlining a clear, confident strategy, indicating uncertainty.
Initially refuses to let Maggie climb with him to protect her, showing concern for her safety.
Reluctantly accepts Maggie joining him after a firm stare down, indicating respect and trust.
Threatens to leave Maggie behind if she slows him down, showing a harsh and conditional attitude.
Maggie helps Gabe when he slips due to his sore leg, suggesting Gabe's vulnerability and reliance on others, but Gabe's demeanor remains tough.
Insists Maggie stay safe and take the responsible role of finding help rather than climbing with him despite her protest; makes clear the practical need to avoid slowing down.
Eventually relents to Maggie climbing with him after initial resistance but sets strict conditions about not being slowed down and being willing to leave her behind if needed.
Favors one foot as he moves, indicating physical pain or injury.
Pauses at the wire's edge, immobile and visibly rattled, recalling Susan's death before steadying himself.
Encourages Maggie by refusing to go first, saying if he doesn't go first, he might not go at all.
Considers the risky wire crossing despite being rattled and haunted by memories, then commits to going first rather than hesitating further.
Momentarily immobilized and distracted by emotional trauma (Susan's death) at a critical moment.
Drags himself across the wire without a safety line, pushing through fatigue and near collapse to complete the challenge.
Grins and jokingly challenges Maggie by shouting across that she can try to beat his time, showing playful camaraderie.
Watches Maggie with admiration and smiles, allowing positive feelings for her to replace bad memories, indicating openness and warmth in relationships.
Hooks his ankles over the wire and drags himself hand over hand across the abyss without a safety line despite fatigue and extreme danger.
Maintains grip and steadies himself despite near collapse and momentary unconscious relaxation of grip, forcing himself to keep going by drawing on inner fury.
Swings feet onto ledge and leans back to catch breath, successfully completing a highly risky and physically demanding crossing.
Recognizes Maggie is in better shape and shows admiration rather than arrogance.
Drops low and catches Maggie with a lightning-fast motion to save her from falling.
Maintains grip on Maggie despite being nearly pulled off the ledge, ensuring her safety.
Holds Maggie tightly after the rescue, showing protective concern.
States he might get himself killed but refuses to let Maggie get killed.
Catches Maggie instantly when the wire breaks and she falls, showing lightning-fast reflexes and physical skill, manages to hold on despite the dangerous situation, and helps her climb up to safety.
Fails to notice the weakening bolt on his side of the wire, which ultimately causes the wire to snap while Maggie is crossing.
Expresses deep concern for Maggie's safety, pleads with her to survive and escape the mountain, and shares a gentle, non-farewell kiss.
Shows concern for Maggie's safety, instructs her clearly to stay on the trail and out of sight, plans to catch up with Hal, demonstrating care and tactical thinking.
No indication of hesitation or confusion; calmly accepts the gravity of the situation and proceeds with his plan.
Carefully jogs and leaps across narrow mountain ledges with skill and purpose.
Jogging and leaping across a narrow ledge with ease, showing skill and familiarity with the terrain.
Having renewed purpose and second wind while navigating dangerous mountain ledges confidently.
Expresses frustration with the Bitker ladder but takes it in stride and completes the climb.
Replants the park service sign at the top of another slope, showing respect for the place and its history.
Replants the 'Bitker' sign near the top of a slope to signal his location to others.
Rushed to gather scattered cash from the snow, showing focus on material gain without hesitation.
Leans back relieved upon seeing a frightened rabbit rather than showing fear or aggression.
Collects scattered, frozen cash efficiently while remaining vigilant and calm when startled by a rabbit, showing presence of mind and composure under pressure.
Watches Qualen's futile pursuit from a safe vantage point, appearing amused and composed.
Fails to notice Kristel pointing a gun at him, resulting in his temple hitting the gun barrel.
Warns Kristel about Qualen’s plan, giving her valuable information to prevent danger.
Uses humor and sarcasm (calling Kristel gullible) during a tense moment.
Successfully reads the situation and predicts Qualen's next moves accurately to manipulate Kristel into hesitation, showing strategic thinking and situational awareness.
Uses quick, confident dialogue under threat of being shot, demonstrating calmness and control in a dangerous situation.
Approaches Kristel with a plausible, logical argument about the helicopter's fuel efficiency that convinces her, showing his ability to leverage technical knowledge under pressure.
No direct actions or decisions by Gabe are described in this excerpt.
Confidently leads Kristel down a slope toward the target location, identifies a key objective (the shed)
Shows a sudden burst of enthusiasm to help by indicating and offering to show Kristel the storage shed with supplies needed to get off the mountain.
Insists on leading and showing Kristel the route despite her suspicions and threats, indicating willingness to cooperate and help even under tension.
Responds to Kristel’s threat with a blunt and somewhat tense comment ('Don't fuck up'), showing a strained but still engaged communication.
Shows sudden burst of enthusiasm and moves quickly ahead, confidently indicating location of supplies.
Persuades Kristel that walking straight ahead is faster and safer, showing knowledge of terrain and tactical thinking.
Drops flat to avoid sinking into snow and scrambles back to solid ground, demonstrating situational awareness and survival skills.
Fails to heed the warning of the snowdrift sign and nearly crosses a dangerous snowdrift himself.
Despite being under heavy fire and injured, manages to steer the dangerous slide away from trees and boulders, showing presence of mind and determination.
After getting hit and sliding out of control, painfully lifts himself up and continues moving forward, demonstrating perseverance but no explicit indication of warmth.
Manages to survive a dangerous uncontrolled slide despite being hit and wounded in the shoulder, and continues moving towards the lake and the bridge.
Endures injury and freezing conditions while hiding under the bridge to protect or save a friend.
Leaves empty parka as a decoy to mislead the enemy, risking his own safety.
Hides effectively under the bridge in a tight network of steel supports, avoiding detection.
Leaves a misleading blood trail ending at the parka, suggesting a deliberate attempt to deceive the pursuer.
Clings to steel supports exposed and vulnerable to enemy fire, risking hypothermia and injury.
Uses ice axe to disarm Qualen and pulls him down from the bridge, engages physically to stop an immediate threat.
Engages in intense physical fight with Qualen to survive despite injuries.
Uses his ice axe to hook Qualen's machine gun and yanks him down from the bridge edge.
Engages in a dangerous fistfight on unstable supports despite a shoulder wound, holding his own and creatively using his leg to swing and twist Qualen's leg, causing Qualen to lose grip.
Maintains balance and tactical awareness on the unstable ice raft amidst a whirlpool, circling cautiously with Qualen and adjusting positioning to avoid both falling off.
Recovers Qualen's machine gun and attempts to use it despite it being empty, showing presence of mind to try using available resources.
Misses grabbing his ice axe as it floats by, losing a key weapon to his opponent.
Grabs for ice axe to protect himself and engage Qualen in a dangerous confrontation, takes careful action to survive.
Struggles to his feet, looks down wincing, showing vulnerability and exhaustion but presses on.
Leaps across dangerous ice chunks to survive, taking careful/strategic moves under pressure.
After slipping off the bridge support, allows himself to be pulled up by Hal, exchanges a friendly grin.
Tells Hal to get Maggie out of danger and shows concern for her safety.
Thanks Hal for asking him to join and admits enjoyment in rescue work, showing openness and camaraderie.
Uses a bluff with the emptied gun to protect himself and possibly others, indicating resourcefulness rather than direct hostility.
Tries to load a wrong-size ammo clip into Qualen's gun, then manages a bluff by leveling an emptied gun at the helicopter to protect the money.
Expresses frustration openly when things get difficult ('Why can't anything be easy?'), showing momentary doubt.
Demonstrates leadership by directing Hal to stay in the woods and focus on getting Maggie out, prioritizing the mission.
Limping toward the mountain edge with confidence and readiness to bluff despite injury, showing resilience and tactical thinking.
Relies on a bluff with an empty gun to negotiate with the helicopter, showing skillful use of limited resources under pressure.
Persuades Travers to release Maggie by promising safety; urges Maggie to run to safety before risking himself.
Throws gun away after ensuring Maggie is safe, showing restraint and prioritizing life over violence.
Maintains calm and firm stance despite risk to himself, attempts to de-escalate situation by taunting Travers with remaining money.
Maintains calm and taunts Travers to provoke him into letting Maggie go and dropping the gun, showing control over a tense situation.
Commands Maggie to run to safety multiple times, ensuring her protection before advancing his own position.
Keeps the money pack suspended over the edge while throwing away the gun, demonstrating tactical restraint and prioritizing the money.
Stands firm against the helicopter's wind and hostile threat, showing physical and mental resilience.
Uses psychological tactics by mocking Travers into opening the money pack, revealing he is aware of the damage to the money inside.
Shoots Travers preemptively to prevent threat despite potential harm to Travers, speaks harshly ("son of a bitch")
Flattens himself instantly to avoid helicopter tail, showing concern for own safety but not actively helping Travers
Stares coldly, waiting for crash without intervening emotionally or showing empathy
Rips open his parka and shoots Travers to stop him from further danger.
Throws himself flat into the snow to avoid being run down by the helicopter, minimizing harm to others.
Continues to move forward toward safety despite injury and threat, showing resilience but no explicit warmth.
Throws himself flat into the snow to avoid being run down by the helicopter, risking his life to survive.
Despite being badly injured and in danger, continues to move toward safety rather than giving up.
Flattens to avoid the helicopter tail while it spins uncontrollably, showing presence of mind and quick reaction.
Realizes Travers regained control of the helicopter and adjusts expectations accordingly, indicating situational awareness.
Runs back toward the woods despite injury and disadvantage against the helicopter, demonstrating resolve though physical limits impose challenges.
Throws himself flat into the snow to narrowly avoid being hit by the helicopter skids, showing quick reflexes under pressure.
Dives off the mountain edge just ahead of the helicopter and manages to grab the cable ladder rung despite a painful fall, displaying exceptional courage and physical skill.
Hangs on with one arm to a thrashing cable ladder attached to a helicopter trying to escape, enduring extreme circumstances with resilience.
Is repeatedly outpaced by the helicopter in a direct chase through rough snowy terrain, indicating a physical disadvantage though not necessarily a failure of skill.
Shows calmness and focus under extreme danger, avoids panic while helicopter spins uncontrollably.
Keeps trying to escape and survive despite severe injury and imminent threat, demonstrating perseverance but no direct hostile or cold behavior.
After struggling to survive the helicopter crash, when Travers leaps and grabs Gabe's leg, Gabe reassures him with 'Cheer up....'
Cheerfully tells Travers to 'Cheer up' as Travers is about to fall to his death
Clings to the ladder after the crash, exhausted and drained, showing perseverance
Refuses to climb further due to exhaustion and self-preservation, vocalizing his limit
Accepts help from Hal and Maggie promptly and with trust
Clings to the ladder despite exhaustion after helicopter crash, looks for strength to continue.
Considers free climbing a fifty-foot wall but admits being too drained to move, deciding to stay put instead.
Responds appropriately and calmly by putting on the rescue rope loop quickly and with practiced skill despite his pain.
Collapses into Maggie's lap after a strenuous climb, showing vulnerability and trust.
Engages in a passionate kiss with Maggie after a life-threatening situation.
Responds with a frustrated 'Fuck you' to Hal despite being exhausted, which is abrasive but likely out of physical and emotional strain.
Puts the loop around himself and tightens it by rote despite being in pain, helping in his own rescue.
Pulls some of his weight by using hand and foot holds during the haul to the precipice edge.
Collapses into Maggie's lap immediately after being rescued, showing physical exhaustion but no further action.
Responds to Hal's criticism silently and instead revives to share a meaningful kiss with Maggie, indicating emotional strength but not addressing the competence critique.
